reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel and we very pleased with the offering of the Vibe Hotel. We arrived at 11am and were given our room straight away and it was a very spacious room (their standard) and contained a sofa, dressing room area in addition to the usual bed, bathroom, dressing table and mini bar. The windows werent the best and let in a slight bit of the road noise but after a day around Sydney that was no issue. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but did partake of the lunch menu at AUD12.50 including a drink and utilised a voucher you can find near reception at the back of a leaflet book for a buy one get one free main meal for dinner one night which was very nice. Location is great and just a two minute walk to the Museum train stop which is 15 mins from the airport at AUD15. The whole city is within walking distance of the hotel - circa 20 mins to the Harbour, you can purchase for a ound AUD30 a bus pass from central station (10 min walk away) for the tourist bus that takes you to all the sights and the beach and is well worth it. There is a pool and although small is great to sit besides and relax after a day of sightseeing. Would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Great Rooms

reviews.text: I stayed at the vibe with my daughter for a couple of nights last year. The hotel was just as described and our room was exactly as the 3rd picture when you look at the photos on this site. Loved the location , service was great ,bed was so comfortable and room very clean, It was a great mother/daughter time.At a specials price 199 for 2 nights it was so very worth it. Am going to book for another few nights and my eye caught on some of the reveiws, sorry a few werent happy with the hotel, but we were so i felt i had to tell my reveiw of it .
reviews.title: Found the hotel to be as described

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ((Warning)) Just DO NOT go to the Indian restuarant around the corner of the hotel, we got to the hotel late and were very hungry and wanted take away, the only place close by that was open at 9.30 was this resturant. We took the food back to the hotel room and never tasted anything so bad!! all the meals literally tasted like dirty dishwater and Im not exaggerating. We went to bed hungry and $60 out of pocket.
reviews.title: OK but not brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: You could get better for your money...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: - Service at front desk was very friendly
reviews.title: Disappointed I wasted so much on low grade accomodation

reviews.text: - Baggage delivery to room was prompt (note I traveled with a large tour group)
reviews.title: I liked the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: 5 Star Service!!

reviews.text: I stayed for a week in early December for work. The hotel is located at Goulburn Street. The surrounding is just buildings. Being a foreigner and a 1st time visitor to Sydney, I found the place was safe and vibrant.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel located near Chinatown
King Suite, nice Hotel- but not special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walk down the road, there is Chinatown and plenty of Japanese, Korean and fast food place. I even found a Malaysian eatery. There is cinema complex nearby and pubs every corner.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel to Explore Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transportation is easy. Plenty of cabs and Museum train station is nearby. There is a few convenience store nearby. Please avoid those and head to 7-11 as the those convenience store doesn't have a price tag on items and the prices varies by store.
reviews.title: Okay hotel but beware deceptive check in

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights for a weekend in Sydney. We thought it was a great location, walking distance to Chinatown and even down to the harbour if you've got your walking shoes on, otherwise its just 2 stops on the train to Circular Quay. Room was quite spacious, quiet and clean. My sister found a great Thai massage place just 1 min walk up from hotel. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: My friends and I had made reservations for the King Master Suite with a specific request for the room with the grand piano. This booking was made a fair few weeks in advance, with the lady over the phone ensuring us that we would get the room. We were all looking forward to the experience.
reviews.title: Disappointing organisation

reviews.text: Unfortunately, upon arrival I was told that not only was the room with the piano taken, but so were ALL the Master king suites for that day. As a result, they had us downgraded to an executive suite. No refund was offered. Our compensation was a complimentary buffet breakfast, which I explained would not be of any use to us as we would be having a late night and thus were unlikely to wake up in time for this. We were then offered discounts on drinks and services, but again I explained we would not be present for long enough to make use of them. This seemed like the best they could do, which was disappointing.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lady at the reception counter was nice enough about it, but at the end of the day I don't think such a mistake was excusable, especially considering how early we had everything booked.
reviews.title: Terrific value hotel on the edge of Sydney's hoppin' CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed two nights at the Vibe on Goulburn Street in November. The place was very convenient for my business trip, being close to my meeting venues, and close to shopping for afterwards.
reviews.title: loved the location
